a.title: Calendar
a.p: FHSD events can be viewed in the District calendar. For specific school calendars, please go to the calendar tab on the individual school website.

a.title: Nutrition Services
a.p: FHSD partners with Sodexo to provide students with nutritious and delicious meals. Here you can view menus or make online meal payments.

a.title: Parent Portal
a.p: Infinite Campus allows parents and students to access secure student information including class schedules, assignments, attendance, and grades.

a.title: News
a.p: Visit our news section for the latest information about upcoming events, student accomplishments, and everything happening in our schools.

a.title: FHSD Celebrates School Bus Driver Day

div.div: FHSD Celebrates School Bus Driver Day

In honor of School Bus Driver Day, FHSD would like to celebrate our valuable employees who safely transport our students to and from school each day. While our students are currently unable to greet our bus drivers each day due to the COVID-19 pandemic, we can still give a shout out to our transportation staff and thank them for their service.

div.span: Read More About FHSD Celebrates School Bus Driver Day

a.title: Voting in FHSD June 2 – COVID Considerations

img.alt: Voting in FHSD June 2 – COVID Considerations

div.div: Voting in FHSD June 2 – COVID Considerations

In March, Governor Parson signed an Executive Order requiring all Missouri municipal elections scheduled for April 7 to be postponed until June 2, 2020. This order includes Proposition S, the Francis Howell no tax rate increase bond issue, and the FHSD Board of Education candidate election. As a result of the COVID-19 pandemic, the St. Charles County Election Authority is anticipating increased participation in absentee voting ahead of the June 2 election.

div.span: Read More About Voting in FHSD June 2 – COVID Considerations

a.title: Two FHSD Students Achieve Perfect ACT Scores

img.alt: Two FHSD Students Achieve Perfect ACT Scores

div.div: Two FHSD Students Achieve Perfect ACT Scores

To many, the number 36 doesn’t carry any special significance. But for two high school students in FHSD, this number represents perfection. Junior Natalie Althof of Francis Howell High School and senior Eric Peasel of Francis Howell Central High School, have both achieved a perfect score of 36 on the ACT.

div.span: Read More About Two FHSD Students Achieve Perfect ACT Scores
Empowering Students to be Lifelong Learners Prepared for the Future
